You fight to free her . If you pass, you interrogate the cultists, and Lily is safely returned to the hospital to begin the slow healing process; retreat by 1. If you fail, Lily disappears into the darkness. Whether you pass or not, discard her Investigator token.
defeatedEncounters.lossOfSanity: You barely recognize the small woman huddled in the alleyway, her few belongings scattered next to her. Gain all of her possessions. "It wasn't true," Lily sobs. "I have no destiny. I cannot fight the darkness." You reassure her that she has already done her part and that others will finish the task . If you pass, she chants over you, passing her destiny on to you; retreat by 1. If you fail, Lily eventually falls into a catatonic state. Whether you pass or not, discard her Investigator token.

name: Lola Hayes
quote: I've played so many roles.  Madness is to be expected.
biography: Around the world, Lola has performed dramatic roles for sold-out houses. However, after being cast in the controversial play, The King in Yellow, Lola needed to "take some time" to recover for her "exhaustion." Now that she has checked herself out of the asylum, she's ready for her big comeback. But this time she'll play a different role in the fight against the horrors that threaten this world. She's started by traveling to Tokyo to track down the other surviving cast member of her previous theatrical endeavor.
abilities:
Abilities
* Action: Spend any number of Improvement tokens, then improve 1 skill of your choice for each token spent (a "+2" token counts as 2 tokens).
* Once per round, an investigator on your space may roll 1 additional die when resolving a test.
teamRole: Lola's ability to use an action to change her skills (and improve one right off the bat) enables her to adapt to whatever task the group might be lacking in. With her high Influence, she does well with acquiring assets. Since an investigator can roll an extra die if she is with them, she's a great support-type character.
origin: Lola Hayes made her first appearance in 2008 in Kingsport Horror, the 4th expansion for Arkham Horror: Second Edition.

defeatedEncounters.lossOfHealth: "I'm fine darling. Help yourself, by the way." Lola nods at the equipment strewn across the hotel room. Gain all of her possessions. As convincing as she is, you know she's in pain. You try to persuade her to visit a hospital . If you pass, she sighs a breath of relief and tells you of all the horrors she's encountered; retreat by 1. If you fail, the day after Lola leaves the city, she succumbs to her wounds. Whether you pass or not, discard her Investigator token.
defeatedEncounters.lossOfSanity: The trail of Lola's belongings leads you into a derelict theater. Gain all of her possessions. She's on the stage, wringing her blood-soaked hands and reciting, "Will these hands ne'er be clean?" You try to direct her performance, hoping to better reveal her character . If you pass, she tells you of the Tattered King, indicating a goat she killed; retreat by 1. If you fail, Lola's dialogue degenerates into gibberish. Whether you pass or not, discard her Investigator token.

name: Luke Robinson
quote: The key to the Dreamlands lies within us all.
biography: Luke Robinson, through the gift of an unusual puzzle box from his uncle, discovered the entrance to the Dreamlands many years ago, and has since then spent the majority of his days wandering the land of dreams in search of adventure. From the streets of Celephaïs to the endless mysteries of the Enchanted Wood he wanders, unraveling the secrets of both the land and the myriad dreamers who reside there. Now an ancient chaos threatens to annihilate not only the waking world but the world of his dreams as well.
abilities:
Abilities 
* Action: Move to a space containing a Gate that corresponds to the current Omen.
* During the Encounter Phase, you may spend or to encounter a Gate on your space as if there are no Monsters on your space.
teamRole: Luke Robinson's abilities clearly are suited towards closing gates. His ability to avoid fighting monsters to close gates is especially useful in the late game.
rulings:
* The player controlling Luke chooses to start Luke on any space containing an open Gate. If, for any reason, there are no gates on the board (using the Beginning of the End Prelude for example), the player may choose any space to place Luke.
* Resolving any encounter that requires Luke to occupy a space containing a Gate counts as encountering a Gate for Luke's passive ability. For example, the Caught in the Web Mystery grants a different option for encountering a Gate.
origin: Luke Robinson made his first appearance in 2008 in Kingsport Horror, the 4th expansion for Arkham Horror: Second Edition.

defeatedEncounters.lossOfHealth: You find Luke in good spirits, despite his paralyzed body. He spends most of his days in the Dreamlands, exploring the glittering avenues of Celephaïs, and he has no use of his old adventuring gear. Gain all of his possessions. You try to convince him that there is still good that he could do . If you pass, he rallies the dreamers of Celephaïs against the forces of chaos that lurk in the Dreamlands; retreat by 1. If you fail, he asks you to leave him to his dreams. Whether you pass or not, discard his Investigator token.
defeatedEncounters.lossOfSanity: When you finally track down Luke, he is delirious, and his things are stewn about the floor. Gain all of his possessions. He tells you that he can never sleeps again, lest he fall prey to Hypnos. You help perform a ritual to sever him from the lands of dreams . If you pass, he reminisces sadly about his time in the Dreamlands; gain 1 Walking the Ley Lines Unique Asset, then place the top Gate in the Gate stack on that card. If you fail, Luke fall asleep, never to wake. Whether you pass or not, discard his Investigator token.

name: Mandy Thompson
quote: I will find a way to end this horror. I will not stop searching.
biography: Ever since she was a child, Mandy would read when she could not sleep. Such has been the case on many nights. Her remarkable memory and ability to correlate facts have made her a highly sought-after researcher around the world. Over time, her work has required her to read strange occult texts. These bizarre tomes have slowly caused her to suspect that an ancient being will arise to destroy humanity. Recently, the scrolls she has been reading in Shanghai have made it clear that the world is in immediate danger.
abilities:
Abilities 
* Action: Draw from the Clue pool. Spawn 1 of them and discard the other.
* After resolving a Research Encounter, if you gained exactly from that encounter, gain 1 additional Clue.
teamRole: Mandy's role revolves around clues. She's great at getting them, and her action provides one of the best ways to get clues on the board early in the game, in convenient locations. Her abilities can help prevent death to Rumors or falling short of clues for the first mystery, when not many will have spawned. Low will and strength make her unable to deal with monsters or gates, so she should pair with investigators suited to this purpose.
rulings: After resolving a Research Encounter, Mandy’s passive ability could allow her to gain an additional Clue. However, this Clue is gained from her passive ability, not the Research Encounter.
origin: One of the Investigators in the original Arkham Horror board game published by Chaosium in 1987, in which she was the green pawn.

defeatedEncounters.lossOfHealth: They have left Mandy alive as a grisly warning. She motions to her packed bags with bandaged hands. Gain all of her possessions. Even though her tongue has been removed she tries to use her eyes to direct your attention to something in the room . If you pass, you find a crudely written note under her bed that outlines everything Mandy has come to know; retreat by 1. If you fail, you can do nothing more than arrange a nurse to see to her comfort. Whether you pass or not, discard her Investigator token.
defeatedEncounters.lossOfSanity: When you find Mandy, she hands you all she owns and demands to see your money. Gain all of her possessions. She will never speak coherently again, but her notes describe a global conspiracy. The proof, she wrote, can be found in money. You try to gather currencies from around the world . If you pass, she seems comforted as you uncover the truth; advance the active Mystery by 1. If you fail, she spends the rest of her life begging for pocket change. Whether you pass or not, discard her Investigator token.

name: Marie Lambeau
biography: Marie has come a long way from the Louisiana marshes of her youth. These days, "The Smoky Velvet" sings the blues in elegant nightclubs around the world, but it was grand-mère's dying wish that sent Marie to the Kingdom of Sarawak, where an old evil had returned. Marie doesn't believe she can help, but only a fool didn't listen to grand-mère. Now memories of strange nursery rhymes she used to recite have begun flooding back. People called grand-mère a witch. Maybe Marie's got some witchcraft in her blood, too.
abilities:
Abilities 
* Action: Perform an action you have already performed this round.
* If you would spend or lose as part of a Spell effect, you may spend or lose 1 fewer Sanity as part of that effect.
teamRole: With her high Influence, Marie is good at Acquiring Assets to assist in her endeavors, such as weapons. Her decent Lore also makes her a great person to get spells to destroy monsters or seal Gates.
rulings: Marie Lambeau's passive ability allow her to pay only to activate the Voice of Ra.
origin: Marie Lambeau made her first appearance in 2006 in Dunwich Horror, the 2nd expansion for Arkham Horror: Second Edition. Likely a reference to Marie Laveau, a famous New Orleans voodoo mystic.

defeatedEncounters.lossOfHealth: Marie's belongings are in boxes by her front door. Gain all of her possessions. Since she received the ugly scar across her throat, she hasn't uttered a word. She just listens to recordings of her songs on her Victrola. You ask her to share what she's learned . If you pass, she absently points to a journal she's been keeping and returns to her songs; improve and gain 1 Glamour Spell. If you fail, she never responds and drinks herself to death over the following months. Whether you pass or not, discard her Investigator token.
defeatedEncounters.lossOfSanity: The police tell you she bled to death in her hotel room after drawing on the walls with a mixture of powders and her own blood. She left a note naming you as her heir. Gain all of her possessions. Looking at the photos of what she drew, you think you recognize certain voodoo symbols . If you pass, you understand the sigil's protective significance; retreat by 1. If you fail, Marie takes the secrets she learned from her grand-mère to the grave. Whether you pass or not, discard her Investigator token.

name: Mark Harrigan
quote: I'm walking out that door, and I'm taking this book. Anyone who wants to stop me is welcome to try.
biography: During the war, Mark witnessed horrors he could not explain, and he wrote of what he saw in letters to his beloved wife, Sophie. When Mark returned home, he discovered that Sophie was no longer human. One of the beasts that Mark had seen overseas had taken over her body, killing her in the process. Afterward, Mark's thirst for vengeance lead him to Helsinki, where some of these creatures had posed as German soldiers during the Great War.
abilities:
Abilities
* Action: You and 1 Monster on your space each lose .
* You cannot become Delayed or gain a Detained Condition unless you choose to.
teamRole:
Mark Harrigan is very good at fighting monsters, but not much else. Perfect for the distracted or disinterested player who just wants the basics, as long as the rest of the team can pick up the slack.

His lopsided stats mean he may often run into trouble during encounters, but he partners well with gate closers that have no way to handle monsters on their own.
rulings:
* Mark's passive ability prevents the investigator from becoming Delayed unless he chooses to become Delayed to pay for an effect. If the Lead Investigator or investigators as a group choose Mark to become Delayed, that choice does not pay for an effect, therefore he can negate that effect with his passive ability. This remains true regardless of his role in the decision making process and even if the Lead Investigator is Mark and he chooses himself. For example, his ability would prevent him from being affected by Patrolling the Border.
* If an effect has a choice between two or more outcomes and Mark chooses to become Delayed or to gain a Detained Condition from that effect, he is Delayed or gains a Detained Condition, respectively. Mark is not affected by effects that say "become Delayed" or "gain a Detained Condition" without a choice.
* If an effect says, "Become Delayed unless," or, "Gain a Detained Condition unless," Mark is not affected by that effect, even if he chooses not to resolve the effect following "unless."
* If an effect says "…unless you become Delayed" or "…or you become Delayed" and Mark chooses to become Delayed from that effect, he is Delayed.
origin: Mark Harrigan made his first appearance in 2006 in Dunwich Horror, the 2nd expansion for Arkham Horror: Second Edition. His character is possibly partially inspired by [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sailor_Steve_Costigan sailor Steve Costigan].

defeatedEncounters.lossOfHealth: While you are collecting Mark's things, you smell smoke on the hospital. Gain all of his possessions. The hospital has been set on fire, and you run to Mark's room and try to carry him to safety . If you pass, Mark is able to tell you who set the fire; retreat by 1. If you fail, the smoke overcomes Mark, and he dies outside the hospital. Whether you pass or not, discard his Investigator token.
defeatedEncounters.lossOfSanity: You take custody of Mark's belongings and arrange to visit him in the asylum. Gain all of his possessions. To your dismay, Mark is convinced that you are a creature disguising itself as a human. You do your best to convince him that you are telling the truth . If you pass, he shows you sketches he made of the horrible monsters that he's been hunting; retreat by 1. If you fail, Mark screams accusations of murder at you. Whether you pass or not, discard his Investigator token.

name: Michael McGlen
quote: Don't care if it's a god. If it crosses me, it's gonna regret it.
biography: When the O'Bannion gang needs to send a message, they send the big man, Michael McGlen. Not long ago, his friend Fast Louie Farrell was attacked by a bunch of inhuman things with ugly, fish-like faces. They sliced him up and dragged him under the water. McGlen took it personally. The word has spread: McGlen has loaded up his Thompson and everyone else had best get out of the way. His first stop is London where he intends to find out what those creatures are called and where he has to go to kill every last one of them.
abilities:
Abilities 
* Action: If you are on a space, you may gain 1 Item or Service Asset of your choice from the reserve. If you do, gain a Wanted Condition.
* Once per round, you may reroll 1 die when resolving a Deal or Pursuit Condition.
teamRole: With his high starting Strength, decent Will, and starting Weapon, Michael is excellent for taking out Monsters, making him a good fit for Ancient Ones like Shub-Niggurath. The ability to gain items or services from the reserve in exchange for a Wanted Condition can be useful in a pinch. Because his effect works for any deal, Dark Pacts may be less of a hindrance for him, because it is unlikely he will roll two 1's in a row.
rulings:
*Michael McGlen can use his action ability if he has a Wanted Condition. If he does, he resolves all effects of the ability except that he will not gain another Wanted Condition.
*Michael McGlen’s passive ability allows him to reroll any single die that is rolled as part of a Deal or Pursuit Condition’s effect even if the die is not rolled as part of a test. This includes the one die rolled when resolving the effect of a Dark Pact Condition or a Promise of Power Condition.
origin: Michael McGlen made his first appearance in 2005 in Arkham Horror: Second Edition.

defeatedEncounters.lossOfHealth: McGlen disapeared from the hospital, leaving his things behind. Gain all of his possessions. Over the years, McGlen hurt a lot of people, and now some local thugs plan to take revenge. You track down one of the kidnappers and try to force him to tell you where they are keeping him . If you pass, you find McGlen wounded, but in good spirits; retreat by 1. If you fail, the police eventually find his body after what looks to have been a very violent death. Whether you pass or not, discard his Investigator token.
defeatedEncounters.lossOfSanity: McGlen tells you that Louie came to him in a dream and ask him to steal some jewelry in a museum for his new boss. After this robbery, McGlen says, he is going to join a new gang under the waves, and there is no talking him out of it. But first, he wants to cut you in on the deal, and the new boss is willing to pay big. You may spend 2 and gain a Wanted Condition to gain all of his possessions and a Promise of Power Condition. Whether you accept the offer or not, discard his Investigator token.

name: Minh Thi Phan
quote: You can depend on me to guide you through the unknown.
biography: Phan Thi Minh's father came to Seoul from Cochinchina to use his diplomatic savvy in dealing with foreign business interests. Once grown, Minh proved to be just as adept in business. She reordered her name in the style of Westerners and took a job in Tokyo as a secretary to an importer of strange antiquities. More than just an employer, Mr.Thomas was Minh's friend, but now he has been murdered. Armed with only the strange text Mr. Thomas left for her and her own keen mind, Minh has vowed to find out why.
abilities:
Abilities 
* Action: You and another investigator on your space each gain 1 travel ticket of your choice.
* You and other investigators on your space each gain +1 to all skills if there is another investigator on your space or you have one or more Ally assets.
teamRole: Minh is very useful as an "escort", providing free tickets to an ally and boosting the skills of all investigators at her location. Her skill bonuses as well as well rounded stats makes her fairly capable herself as well.
rulings:
*Minh’s action ability allows her to gain a travel ticket of her choice, even if her space is not connected to another space by the appropriate path. Furthermore, Minh can use her action ability even if she is not on a space.
*The travel ticket Minh gains from her active ability can be different from the travel ticket she allows another investigator to gain.
origin: Minh Thi Phan made her first appearance in 2009 in Innsmouth Horror, the 6th expansion for Arkham Horror: Second Edition.

defeatedEncounters.lossOfHealth: The doctors say Minh is in agony, and can only sit upright for brief period. She has boxed up her things for you. Gain all of her possessions. Some of Mr. Thomas's estate is still held up in a legal battle. You hope to settle the matter . If you pass, you acquire several important documents; gain , improve , and gain 1 Cryptic Text Unique Asset. If you fail, she apologises for being unable to continue to help. Whether you pass or not, discard her Investigator token.
defeatedEncounters.lossOfSanity: In the lobby of her hotel, Minh asks you to help yourself to a gift while she waits for Mr. Thomas. Gain all of her possessions. She mutters using a combination of English, Vietnamese, Korean, and other much older languages . If you pass, you discern that she is asking her father to help her and refers to specific ways to stave off the end of the world; retreat by 1. If you fail, she seems sad and continues to wait for the late Mr. Thomas. Whether you pass or not, discard her Investigator token.

name: Monterey Jack
quote: To find a treasure like that, I'll risk a few poison darts.
biography: Young Jack traveled the world with his father's archaeological expeditions. He acquired the nickname "Monterey" after a bout of quinine-induced jaundice turned his skin yellow. Once grown, Jack became an accomplished archaeologist in his own right. Now he must explore his own past. His father was found murdered with an arcane sigil carved into the old man's forehead. Here in Cairo, he has seen men wearing this sigil on pendants around their neck. It is time for Jack to start digging.
abilities:
Abilities 
* Action: You may discard 1 Artifact to retreat by 1; or discard the top card of the Expedition Encounter deck and perform 1 additional action.
* After resolving an Expedition Encounter, gain 1 Relic Unique Asset.
teamRole: Monterey is a versatile character best used for support. His stats make him ideal for expeditions, and his action can move the expedition away from an inconvenient space for free once per turn. This allows him to obtain strong artifacts for the team, or to simply push back Doom as often as possible. He can also help resolve research encounters as he moves between expeditions. Because of his high strength and starting weapon, he can become an excellent fighter during combat encounters, if he's able to increase his Will. Because of his stat spread, he should be paired with an Influence investigator and someone who can deal with gates.
origin:
One of the Investigators in the original Arkham Horror board game published by Chaosium in 1987, in which he was the orange pawn.

Monterey Jack is the name of a cheese, the name of a rat from a Disney cartoon, and a homologue of Indiana Jones (name of a place + name starting with J).

defeatedEncounters.lossOfHealth: A lifetime of venom from spiders, scorpions and snakes is taking its final toll on Jack. Even as he struggles to breathe, he shares anecdotes about each of his belongings. Gain all of his possessions. He tells you he buried his best finds in a field, but cannot remember where. You spend hours digging that field . If you pass, you discover Jack was not lying; gain 2 Relic Unique Assets. If you fail, you exhaust yourself with no result. Whether you pass or not, discard his Investigator token.
defeatedEncounters.lossOfSanity: Jack has carved an arcane sigil into his flesh dozens of times. The asylum no longer allows him to access to his belongings for fear he will continue. Gain all of his possessions. He says he must keep digging and tears at his skin with his fingernails. You beg him to stop . If you pass, he calms down enough to explain the significance of the symbol and how to use it against the coming darkness; retreat by 1. If you fail, the orderlies are forced to sedate him. Whether you pass or not, discard his Investigator token.

name: Norman Withers
quote: Let them call me a crackpot! Something is happening to the stars, and I am not imagining it.
biography: The scientific community ridiculed Norman for his claim that six stars disappeared from the sky. After exhausting every plausible astronomical explanation for answers, he took a position at Miskatonic University and began exploring more improbable possibilities in the restricted section of their library. While reading an ancient text of dark prophecies, Norman found an exact description of the phenomenon he'd observed. If the tome is to be believed, a terrible incursion into our world is imminent.
abilities:
Abilities 
* Action: Spend to discard 1 Monster on a space containing a Gate.
* Once per round, you may spend in place of spending .
teamRole: Norman's stats and abilities, which can be used to clear out the monster guarding a gate or get a "free" reroll, make him suited to closing gates.
origin: Norman Withers made his first appearance in 2009 in Innsmouth Horror, the 6th expansion for Arkham Horror: Second Edition.

defeatedEncounters.lossOfHealth: Norman can barely move in his hospital bed and points to his notes and suitcase. Gain all of his possessions. He begs you to use his telescope to record the current locations of the stars. The work is slow and demanding, but you focus at best you can to give him accurate results . If you pass, Norman's insight into the Ancient One proves accurate; retreat by 1. If you fail, Norman can make no sense of the night sky. Whether you pass or not, discard his Investigator token.
defeatedEncounters.lossOfSanity: The doctors would like you to look at Norman l's notes and belongings. Gain all of his possessions. They are trying to gain some insight into his catatonic state. You try to convince them to move Norman to a room with a view of the night sky . If you pass, Norman becomes slightly responsive, and you are able to question him; retreat by 1. If you fail, Norman's condition grows steadily worse. Whether you pass or not, discard his Investigator token.

name: Patrice Hathaway
quote: When I play the violin, the music echoes in other worlds.
biography: Hailed as a musical prodigy from her youth, Patrice has performed for royalty and society's brightest minds all around the world. For years she thought that her consciousness simply drifted as she played, but she's come to believe that an intelligence exists behind her visions. Somehow the notes form a bridge between her own mind and another. The more she grasps what her music exposes her to, the more afraid she becomes. After last night's concert in Sydney, she's finally decided to take action.
abilities:
Abilities 
* Action: You may spend and to improve 1 skill of your choice.
* When you close a Gate during an Other World Encounter, gain and .
teamRole:
With her high starting Willpower and Lore, along with her Banishment spell, Patrice is naturally built for removing threats from and closing gates. She is able to focus and use her investigator action from the starting turn, effectively sacrificing early game momentum to increase one of her skills. Starting close to Shanghai allows her a chance at further increasing her Lore. 

While primarily she can be used for closing gates and casting spells, her high starting Observation allows her to be a great clue gatherer and mystery solver. Her Cadenza personal story isn't difficult to accomplish, which effectively turns her into a clue generating bank for other investigators. 

She pairs well with support investigators such as; Jacqueline Fine, who is able to funnel her clues, Minh Thi Phan and Finn Edwards, who are able to assist her movement and shuttle her around the board, and any high influence investigators that can buy items from the reserve for her to further increase her stats.
origin: Patrice Hathaway made her first appearance in 2009 in Innsmouth Horror, the 6th expansion for Arkham Horror: Second Edition.

defeatedEncounters.lossOfHealth: Tragically, the accident cracked her skull, scarred her face, and left her completely deaf. The doctors place you in charge of her belongings. Gain all of her possessions. She's only awake for short periods of time. You try to keep her attention and learn what she knows . If you pass, she communicates the message being sent to her through her music; retreat by 1. If you fail, she drifts off to sleep again. Whether you pass or not, discard her Investigator token.
defeatedEncounters.lossOfSanity: Patrice doesn't speak. She just plays the violin. You can take what you like without objection. Gain all of her possessions. The music she plays is so discordant and unnerving, it's hard to endure . If you pass, the sounds eventually open a part of your mind that you've never experienced before, connecting to dimensional energies; close 1 Gate of your choice on any space. If you fail, the sound devolve into sharp, uneven noises, and then to silence. Whether you pass or not, discard her Investigator token.

name: Preston Fairmont
quote: ''My money, my legacy, my problem. Let me handle it in my own way.
biography: Born with a silver spoon in his mouth, Preston was doted upon by his parents, and by all account should have lived a prosperous life free of worry and hardship. When his father died, he inherited an unimaginable fortune, but there are some things money can't buy. Downtrodden and depressed, Preston wasted money on gambling and women, until one night a seance performed by one of his girls brought him into contact with the spirit of his father - and shed a disturbing light on the source of the family income.
abilities:
Abilities 
* Action: You and another investigator on your space may perform an Acquire Assets action and/or a Gather Resources action.
* Once per round, when you gain an Asset from the reserve or deck, recover .
teamRole: With his unmatched Influence and starting asset, Preston is all about gaining Assets to assist himself and the team. His low Will will be a hindrance in fighting Monsters, but finding a way to compensate for that can also make him decent at combat provided he can obtain a weapon.
rulings: The actions granted by Preston’s action ability can be performed in any order, including allowing the other investigator to perform actions before or after Preston.
origin: Preston was introduced in 2016 in Mansions of Madness: Second Edition.

defeatedEncounters.lossOfHealth: Preston speaks to you in the hospital through his many layers of bandages and slings, and you learn how he came by such an unlucky fate. Retreat by 1. Bitter and unhappy, he complains on his misfortune, but you try to convince him that there is still good to be done in the world . If you pass, he relents, and founds a charity in his family's name; gain all of his possessions. If you fail, he resolves to left the world fix itself; discard all of his possessions. Whether you pass or not, discard his Investigator token.
defeatedEncounters.lossOfSanity: You find Preston scrounging for change in the gutters of à filthy alleyway. He embraces you enthusiastically and tells you of his travels. Retreat by 1. You learn that he still has control of his fortune, but believe it to be cursed and refuses to touch it . If you pass, you convince him to lend you a portion of his wealth; gain all of his possessions. If you fail, he seems utterly committed to his impoverished way of life; discard all of his possessions. Whether you pass or not, discard his Investigator token.

name: Rex Murphy
quote: My sources tell me that the world is ending. Just my luck.
biography: When disaster strikes, Rex Murphy is usually on hand, suffering the consequences. After spending a day with Rex, even the most hardened skeptic will concede that the man is cursed. To survive, Rex has developed an inquisitive mind, trying to keep one step ahead of the next disaster. His terrible fortune has more than once exposed him to the monstrous forces that threaten this world. He hopes he can get some writing done in Alaska, far away from anything that might go too wrong.
abilities:
Abilities 
* Action: Gain any number of Assets of your choice from the reserve with total value less than your .
* If you do not have a Cursed Condition, gain , improve 1 skill of your choice, and gain a Cursed Condition.
teamRole:
His permanent Cursed condition makes him one of the hardest characters to play. He can use his Lucky Talisman to get OK odds on research encounters, but he should avoid combat and multi-stage encounters. Should he acquire an easy way to discard his Curse (Witch Doctor works best), he can quickly boost his skills.

Rex works best at gaining assets with his component action, since it doesn't require any test rolls, and with +2 Influence improvement, he can take even the 4 cost assets from the reserve, and later trade them to those that need them most.
origin: Rex Murphy made his first appearance in 2008 in Kingsport Horror, the 4th expansion for Arkham Horror: Second Edition. He is possibly inspired by Canadian journalist Rex Murphy (although this could be a coincidence).

defeatedEncounters.lossOfHealth: The doctors say Rex is going to make a full recovery, and some good Samaritans found his belongings and returned them to you. Gain all of his possessions. Overjoyed about his good fortune, Rex will not stop talking about his plans after he leaves the hospital. You try to get him to focus on what he has learned . If you pass, he shares what he has uncovered; retreat by 1. If you fail, he is too happy to think about such things. Whether you pass or not, the next day a gas main explodes, leaving Rex burned and broken; discard his Investigator token.
defeatedEncounters.lossOfSanity: The priests have given up on their exorcism, leaving Rex tied down and muttering in forgotten languages. Everything he owned has been throwned around the room. Gain all of his possessions. You can see that you are the only one who can take this dark burden from him . If you pass, the shadow passes from him, and Rex passes away peacefully; you may gain a Cursed Condition to retreat by 3. If you fail, his body may still be alive, but Rex no longer inhabits it. Whether you pass or not, discard his Investigator token.

name: Rita Young
quote: You got a bone to pick? Fine by me. I don't need your permission to leave you in the dust.
biography: Clocks do not lie. In the past, people said hurtful things to Rita. They threatened her. But since she started running competitively, Rita has only cared about the clock. Most of the time, it says that Rita is faster than the rest. It says she is stronger and has trained harder. Now she competes around the world and has attracted some unwanted attention. The prejudices of certain esoteric cults cannot tolerate her successes. They plan to make an example of her. But they will have to catch her, and the clock says they cannot.
abilities:
Abilities 
*Action: You may spend or to gain 1 Talent Condition.
*Add 1 to the result of each die rolled as part of an Illness, Injury, or Madness Condition effect.
origin: Rita Young made her first appearance in 2006 in Dunwich Horror, the 2nd expansion for Arkham Horror: Second Edition.

defeatedEncounters.lossOfHealth: The police tell you that Rita snuck out of the hospital on her own, despite the fact that all of her belongings were left behind. Gain all of her possessions. You insist that an investigation is required and try to exert political pressure on the authorities to look into the matter . If you pass, the police break up the cult that abducted her and she spends her long recovery writing; retreat by 1. If you fail, you never find out what happened to her. Whether you pass or not, discard her Investigator token.
defeatedEncounters.lossOfSanity: When you find Rita, she had shed all remnants of her former life. She seems possessed by a strange, otherworldly persona with vast arcane knowledge. Discard all of her possessions and retreat by 1. Her new identity challenges you to a series of competitions . If you pass, she tutors you in certain arts before she disappears forever; gain 3 Talent Conditions. If you fail, she mocks your weakness and leaves you behind. Whether you pass or not, discard her Investigator token.

name: Roland Banks
quote: Every 'i' dotted, every 't' crossed.
biography: Even those who work closely with Roland would never say they know him well. They know he is a tireless agent for the Bureau of Investigation with a knack for conspiracies and the occult. They know he follows every letter of the law—even to his own detriment—and that his belief in the justice of the law is second to none. But they do not know him. They do not know the things he has seen or the doubts that cloud his thoughts. If ever his faith in the system was shaken, they would never know. He says nothing. He sees everything.
abilities:
Abilities 
*Action: Set aside any number of Service Assets from the reserve.
*Once per round, during the Action Phase, you or another investigator may gain 1 Service Asset that you have set aside, discard 1 card from the reserve, or spawn .
teamRole: Roland can set aside Service assets to be used later, which is very useful since the main drawback of a service is that it must be used immediately. This has the benefit of easily cycling the reserve for more powerful cards as well. He also has a high Observation skill and the ability to spawn clues, making him great for Research Encounters.
origin: Roland Banks made his first appearance in 2009 in Innsmouth Horror, the 6th expansion for Arkham Horror: Second Edition.

defeatedEncounters.lossOfHealth: The doctors tell you that before he slipped into a coma, Roland had left specific instructions for you. Gain all of his possessions and any number of Service Assets he set aside. His condition is deteriorating quickly and you pay to have a specialist flown in from abroad to treat him . If you pass, Roland recovers enough to tell you what he has seen; retreat by 1. If you fail, the specialist arrives too late and Roland quietly passes in the night. Whether you pass or not, discard his Investigator token.
defeatedEncounters.lossOfSanity: You spend days searching for Roland without success until one night, he finds you. He throws his belongings at you and begins to babble endlessly about a variety of unrelated subjects. Gain all of his possessions and any number of Service Assets he set aside. You struggle to decipher his confusing monologue . If you pass, you understand the message he means to convey; retreat by 1. If you fail, you hear nothing but meaningless gibberish. Whether you pass or not, discard his Investigator token.

name: Sefina Rousseau
quote: ''Art is a window into a reality beyond our knowing.
biography: Though a gifted painter, Sefina's talents have more often than not been capitalized upon to create forgeries of the works of others. One such commission - that of a surreal alien cityscape titled "Carcosa" - tested Sefina's abilities to their limits. Determined to recreate the work exactly, she worked obsessively until its completion, at which time she was suddenly whisked away to the world of the painting. Waking hours later, covered in paint and blood, Sefina has become determined to discover the secret of the painted city.
abilities:
Abilities 
* Action: You may spend 1 Improvement token to gain , , and . 
* After resolving a test, if you rolled two or more successes, you may spend to improve that skill.
teamRole: Sefina has a high Observation, Will, and Lore, so she'll do well on Other World Encounters and Research Encounters. She is also able to increase her skills if she passes successful tests, leading her to adapt to any different role the party may need.
rulings:
*The two successes required for Sefina’s passive ability to trigger must be rolled on the dice during her test. This is, successes granted by another effect (such as accepting a Bank Loan) do not count toward the requirement. However, Sefina may use any rerolls or other dice manipulation effects to achieve her two successes.
*Based on the ruling for The Messenger, when resolving the "improve 3 skills of your choice" effect, an investigator could choose the same skill multiple times unless doing so would violate the Improvement rules (e.g. choose to improve a skill 2 times when its value is at 1 above its printed value).
origin: Sefina Rousseau made her first appearance in 2017 in The Path to Carcosa, the 2nd expansion for Arkham Horror: The Card Game.

defeatedEncounters.lossOfHealth: A nasty concussion has caused Sefina to go blind, and she barely can control her brush as she applies paint to the canvas. She gestures halfheartedly towards a pile of her things. Gain all of her possessions. You attempt to identify the subject of her painting . If you pass, you realize that it is a self-portrait and the glimmer of a smile passes over her face; retreat by 1. If you fail, you misidentify the art as a horrifying monster and Sefina falls into a deep depression. Whether you pass or not, discard her Investigator token.
defeatedEncounters.lossOfSanity: "Beware the King within the golden star." Sefina rocks back and forth as she works at her easel, and you know her words to have a deeper meaning. Retreat by 1. She acknowledges your presence, but appears to be looking straight through you. You attempt to get her focus on your voice . If you pass, she flies into a frenzy, covering you in a flurry of paint; improve 3 skills of your choice. If you fail, she grows deathly silent. Whether you pass or not, discard all of her possessions and her Investigator token.

name: Silas Marsh
quote: Leave your fears on the docks, lads.  I'll not carry that cargo.  The wind is up! Full sail!
biography: Even as a child in Innsmouth, Silas had a special connection to the sea. He's an able and well-reasoned man on land, but on the ocean he possesses a singular strength and wit. It's earned him a sterling reputation in every port across the globe, particularly in Sydney, where Silas set ashore last night. But this morning, the smell of the briny air carries dread as well as joy. There is something in his past, something in Innsmouth, that he knows will some day catch up to him.
abilities:
Abilities 
* Action: Move 1 space along a , then perform 1 additional action.
* If you are on a space, investigators on your space roll 1 additional die when resolving tests.
teamRole: Silas's unrivaled movement speed and fairly well-rounded stats make him well-suited to getting to and resolving encounters, meaning he can quickly progress the active Mystery. Ironically, one of his weaknesses is combat, given his low Sanity and lack of an effective starting weapon. He should partner with a gate closer and either a fighter or an Influence character who can help him obtain a weapon.
rulings: Silas cannot spend travel tickets to move additional spaces when using his action ability. The additional action granted by this ability does not count against his usual two actions per round. He may use his action ability and the Travel action during the same round.
origin:
Silas Marsh made his first appearance in 2009 in Innsmouth Horror, the 6th expansion for Arkham Horror: Second Edition.

He is likely inspired by/intended to be related to Obed Marsh, "A sea captain and the founder of the Esoteric Order of Dagon in Innsmouth." (Note the mention of Innsmouth and the family name Marsh in the bio). However, as Silas is more pro- than ant- agonist, he is also possibly partially inspired by sailor Steve Costigan.

defeatedEncounters.lossOfHealth: Silas had hidden his belongings in the prearranged cache, but the man itself is nowhere to be found. Gain all of his possessions. You search local hospitals filled with the unidentified dead or dying . If you pass, you find Silas alive but incapacitated, and you arrange a private nurse to watch over him; retreat by 1. If you fail, Silas dies alone and unrecognized. Whether you pass or not, discard his Investigator token.
defeatedEncounters.lossOfSanity: You find Silas and gain all of his possessions. He has grown pale, and his breath has become a loud wheeze. He tells you, "I'm a Marsh. It's in my blood. Not long now, I'll join my family down in the deep." You ask a doctor to watch him overnight . If you pass, the sailor shares all he's learned before dying peacefully in his sleep; retreat by 1. If you fail, Silas surrenders his humanity and disappears into the sea. Whether you pass or not, discard his Investigator token.

name: Sister Mary
quote: The Lord watches over my path. I am armored in faith.
biography: Sister Mary speaks very little of her life before taking her vows. Like so many other young girls, she came from a small town and dreamed of something greater than a small life. The Lord provided. Through His path, she has become a lion of compassion and virtue. She has a natural ability and people are often surprised how driven she is to serve God’s will. The church has sent her to South Africa to investigate a possibly demonic presence. Mary plans to approach the question as she always does, with a clear mind and an unshakable faith.
abilities:
Abilities 
* Action: Test . For each success, you or another investigator on any space may discard 1 Madness Condition.
* You and other investigators on your space add 1 to the result of each die rolled as part of a Bane or Boon Condition effect.
teamRole: Mary is a powerful support character and all-rounder. She can either operate alone as a researcher or gate closer, or travel with another investigator. Whomever she chooses to bless using her Holy Water will benefit from the condition more than normal, as her passive ability means the condition only has a 1 in 6 chance of being lost during a Reckoning effect. She also benefits teams of investigators with low Will, able to remove the Madness conditions they will be susceptible to.
rulings: Sister Mary and each other investigator on her space adds 1 to the result of each die rolled as part of an effect printed on a Condition card that has the Bane or Boon trait. This modification applies whether the die is rolled as part of a test or not. For example, while resolving a Blessed Condition's reckoning effect, Sister Mary would discard the Condition only on a roll of 1. On a roll of 2, which she modifies to a 3, the Blessed Condition is not discarded. Any effect not printed on a Condition card that has the Bane or Boon trait is not affected by her passive ability.
origin: Sister Mary made her first appearance in 2005 in Arkham Horror: Second Edition.

defeatedEncounters.lossOfHealth: The scars do not diminish Mary's beatific face. Despite her devastating wounds, she is glad to see you and offers you items and information that may be of use to you. Gain all of her possessions. She has quickly adapted to a new life here in the hospital, ministering to the other patients. She invites you to speak to them although their stories are heartbreaking . If you pass, you learn much about the resiliency of humanity; retreat by 1. If you fail, Mary wishes you well. Whether you pass or not, discard her Investigator token.
defeatedEncounters.lossOfSanity: The priests will not tell you where they are keeping Mary but offer you what she had with her. Gain all of her possessions. All you are told is that she had a crisis of faith and is very unwell. You try to get anyone in the church to help you . If you pass, you are led to Mary's room, and she tells you what she encountered that destroyed her faith; retreat by 1. If you fail, you never hear from her again. Whether you pass or not, she has no further desire to serve God; discard her Investigator token.

name: Tommy Muldoon
quote: I took an oath to enforce the law. That's what I'm doing.
biography: Most members of the Muldoon family are part of the Boston police force in some way or another. Not long ago, the youngest brother Tommy got his badge. Armed with an eye for detail, fierce courage, and his trusty rifle Becky, young Muldoon is dedicated to law enforcement. Now he finds himself in Anchorage at the request of his cousin, the local sheriff. Something has been killing people, and off the record, his cousin says it's a wendigo. Tommy's not sure he believes any of that, but catching killers is in his blood.
abilities:
Abilities 
* Action: Move 1 Monster of your choice with toughness 3 or less from an adjacent space to your space.
* During the Encounter Phase, other investigators on your space may choose an encounter as if there are no Monsters on your space.
teamRole:
Tommy functions very much like a well-rounded semi-support combat class. Having an initial +1 to Willpower, Tommy's extra stat point gives him a stat advantage over most other investigators at the start of the game. His investigator action allows him to draw monsters away from gates or other spaces using an action, which gives him the ability to pull those monsters away from other investigators if he wasn't able to reach that space with his normal movement, or alternatively, his passive allows other investigators ignore them completely if they share a space with him. 

His well-rounded stats allow him to fend for himself in most situations. He is able to furnish his inventory with weapons to supplement Becky, and pad his stats further, so he isn't shoehorned into a combat role. This allows him to easily complete research encounters, rumors, and expeditions.
origin: Tommy Muldoon made his first appearance in 2009 in Innsmouth Horror, the 6th expansion for Arkham Horror: Second Edition.

defeatedEncounters.lossOfHealth: Tommy's equipment is in his hotel, but no one has seen him for days. Gain all of his possessions. You try to pick up the threads of his investigation . If you pass, you find Tommy tied up in a warehouse, beaten to within an inch of his life, and you get him back to his family in Boston to care for him; retreat by 1. If you fail, Muldoon never turns up. Whether you pass or not, discard his Investigator token.
defeatedEncounters.lossOfSanity: Tommy tells you he's fine, but his tremors tell you a different story. He offers you his investigation notes. Discard all of his possessions and retreat by 1. You try to convince him that he has to give up the investigation . If you pass, he accepts the truth and turns his beloved Becky over to you; gain 1 Carbine Rifle Asset. If you fail, he won't stop investigating, and his body is found a few days later. Whether you pass or not, discard his Investigator token.

name: Tony Morgan
quote: When I find the beast, I'll trap it or put it down for good.
biography: Tony's tracked down low-life scum in every lousy corner of the world, but nothing was quite as bad as Innsmouth. Some creep in Boston skipped bail and tried to hide with family in the small fishing village. It turned out "family" meant vicious fish-like monstrosities that left Tony bloody and half-drowned. Ever since, he's found a new kind of dirtbag to hunt. Ordinary mobster or otherworldly monster, Tony will take it down and find someone willing to pay him for it. Now he's got a lead in Bogotá. Easy money.
abilities:
Abilities 
* Action: Test . If you pass, you may spend up to to gain for each Focus spent.
* When you defeat a Monster during a Combat Encounter, gain .
teamRole:
Between his Handcuffs and his special ability, it is very easy for Tony to gain clues. Coupled with his high Observation, he is very good at dispelling nasty Rumor Mythos cards. 

With his high Strength, he also does a good job at fighting monsters, although a player may wish to invest in some time bulking up his Influence and Will.

A few items and skills, like the Old Journal or Skulduggery, are useful to Tony.
origin: Tony Morgan made his first appearance in 2008 in Kingsport Horror, the 4th expansion for Arkham Horror: Second Edition.

defeatedEncounters.lossOfHealth: Whatever hit Tony hit him hard. His doctors aren't sure if he'll ever awaken from his coma. As the closest thing he has to family, you're placed in charge of his belongings. Gain all of his possessions. You pour over his notes and receipts, looking for what he'd been hunting . If you pass, you discern a pattern to the work he'd been doing; retreat by 1. If you fail, you see a series of jobs for money and nothing more. Whether you pass or not, discard his Investigator token.
defeatedEncounters.lossOfSanity: You find Tony in an abandoned building, surrounded by bone chips, clumps of hair, and other grisly souvenirs. He doesn't seem to care about any of his belongings anymore. Gain all of his possessions. He's beyond all reason. All he wants to do is sell you some of his "trophies" . If you pass, he tells you the story beyond each purchase; retreat by 1. If you fail, he yells at you, warning you never to return or he'll put your hide up for sale. Whether you pass or not, discard his Investigator token.

name: Trish Scarborough
quote: We lie all the time.  But the truth is in there.  You just have to know how to decode people.
biography: Everyone expected great things from Trish when she was young. In school, she excelled in athletics and the sciences, but she surprised everyone after graduation by settling into a humble position at a commercial code company. What almost no one knows is that this particular company is a front for the Bureau's code-breaking agency, the Black Chamber. Now she finds herself in the city of Krasnoyarsk meeting another agent who has important information about an impending threat from a world beyond our own.
abilities:
Abilities
* Action: If you do not have any Clues, gain .
* If an investigator on your space spends a to reroll a die, he may reroll up to 2 dice instead.
teamRole: While low will and sanity limit Trish's effectiveness in combat, her stats and abilities make her ideal for gaining clues, or functioning as a support character via asset-buying and expeditions. She should be partnered with a gate closer so she can focus on mysteries and rumors.
origin: Trish Scarborough made her first appearance in 2009 in Innsmouth Horror, the 6th expansion for Arkham Horror: Second Edition.

defeatedEncounters.lossOfHealth: Trish falls in and out of consciousness when you visit her in the hospital, but she happily turns over her equipment. Gain all of her possessions. Unfortunately, her journal has been sized by the police. You'll have to convince the local authorities to turn the book over to you . If you pass, you can read through all of Trish's notes; retreat by 1. If you fail, the knowledge is lost. Whether you pass or not, discard her Investigator token.
defeatedEncounters.lossOfSanity: The doctor grimly hands you the items Trish had when she was brought in. Gain all of her possessions. "It's not good," he warns. Inside her padded cell, she's written on every surface with a thick black pen. The text is a mix of dozens of codes. You start searching for anything you recognize . If you pass, you spot a hidden message in a familiar code; retreat by 1. If you fail, Trish's message remains locked away. Whether you pass or not, discard her Investigator token.

name: Ursula Downs
quote: Discovery isn't easy, but it's the only worthwhile path.
biography: As a young girl, Ursula constantly climbed trees, scaled rock walls, and explored caves. When it came to her studies, she excelled in history and the sciences. After getting a degree in Archaeology in Boston, she began traveling the world searching for forgotten civilizations. She's an expert in both ancient and contemporary languages, and is capable of enduring the harsh environments she encounters during her expeditions. Recently, Ursula has traveled to Africa to oversee the excavation of a lost city's ruins.
abilities:
Abilities 
* Action: Move 1 space along an , then perform 1 additional action.
* Once per round, you or another investigator on your space may spend 1 less to pay for an effect.
teamRole: With the ability to improve a skill of her choice right off the bat, Ursula can adapt based on the other characters in the game. She can quickly turn into a fighter or magic user. Her skills make it very easy for her to reach Expedition Encounter spaces or tricky Clues, and she can become a practically limitless source of Focus due to her other talents since Focus effects tend to only require spending 1 Focus anyway.
rulings: Once per round, Ursula may choose to spend one fewer Focus when paying for an effect, including spending a Focus to reroll a die when resolving a test. This can reduce the cost of an effect to zero Focus.
origin: Ursula Downs made her first appearance in 2009 in Innsmouth Horror, the 6th expansion for Arkham Horror: Second Edition.

defeatedEncounters.lossOfHealth: The doctors finally rule out Ursula's belongings as being the source of her infection. Gain all of her possessions. Something she was exposed to in her world travels has infected her blood, and now her wounds won't heal. You hope to speak to her about her explorations and implore the specialists treating her to allow a visit . If you pass, she tells you what she's learned in her studies; retreat by 1. If you fail, you are never able to speak with her again. Whether you pass or not, discard her Investigator token.
defeatedEncounters.lossOfSanity: Ursula neglects everything she owns other than her supply of laudanum. Gain all of her possessions. She tells you she's exploring another world in her dreams, but when she's in there alone, she gets lost. You attempt to guide her through her dreams . If you pass, she's holding something from her dreams when she awakes; gain 1 Artifact. If you fail, she slips into a nightmare and never awakes. Whether you pass or not, discard her Investigator token.

name: Vincent Lee
quote: I will find the answers, even if it kills me.
biography: After the third or fourth mutilated body showed up during his time at St. Mary's Hospital in Arkham, Vincent Lee began to suspect that this was no simple case of wild animal attacks. When a young man died screaming in his sleep from a burst heart, Vincent knew for a fact that dark times were ahead. Taking a leave of absence from his position at the hospital, he has set out to ease the suffering of those afflicted by the spreading chaos, hoping that the trail of bodies will lead him to the answers he craves.
abilities:
Abilities 
* Action: You or another investigator on your space may discard 1 Injury or Illness Condition and/or perform a Rest action.
* When you or another investigator on your space performs a Rest action, that investigator may recover 1 additional .
teamRole: Vincent's stats aren't specialized to any particular role, but his Composed Condition makes him a great all-rounder. Depending on the team's needs, he can start off going to Shanghai, Istanbul, or Sydney to improve his stats. He can provide great support to combat-oriented characters who have more sanity than health.
origin: One of the Investigators in the original Arkham Horror board game published by Chaosium in 1987, in which he was the black pawn.

defeatedEncounters.lossOfHealth: You are shocked to see Vincent lying in a pool of his own blood, struggling to perform a complicated surgical procedure on himself. He gasps and motions to his things. Gain all of his possessions. Shaking, you try to follow his instructions and help him complete the surgery . If you pass, you manage to save his life and, though he may never fully recover, he will live; retreat by 1. If you fail, Vincent does not survive the botched surgery. Whether you pass or not; discard his Investigator token.
defeatedEncounters.lossOfSanity: Inside the asylum, you are escorted to a locker room. The orderly at the door gives you Vincent's things and warns you not to get too close. Gain all of his possessions. Inside, you find Vincent, hands bound with rope, gnashing his teeth and struggling to attack you at every opportunity. You try to calm him . If you pass, you manage to pacify him and he warns you of an impending threat; retreat by 1. If you fail, he must be sedated. Whether you pass or not, discard his Investigator token.

name: Wendy Adams
quote: The little things are important. Grown-ups don't see that.
biography: As far as the state was concerned, Wendy had to be placed in an orphanage. Her father was gone and her mother was insane. But Wendy knew that her mother drew sigils and chanted to hide from the nightmares that took Wendy's father. So long as she was in an orphanage, Wendy knew she was vulnerable. The only way to find her father and keep herself safe was to escape. She has one photo of her father, taken in a factory where the signs are in Russian. On the back is the message, "Soon the Red Tide rises. Stay safe, my little girl.
abilities:
Abilities 
* Action: Gain 1 Trinket Asset of your choice from the reserve or discard pile.
* Once per round, if you would gain a non-Deal Condition or an Impairment token, you may choose to not gain that Condition or Impairment token instead.
teamRole: With her high Observation and Will, Wendy is great for gathering Clues. Since she can gain any Trinket from the reserve, she can usually adapt into most situations. Her low Influence might be a problem, so she pairs well with a character that can facilitate assets to her, like , , or .
rulings:
* Wendy's passive ability can stop her from gaining a Condition she chooses to gain. If an effect allows her to gain a Condition as part of a cost, such as "you may gain 1 Madness Condition" or "unless you gain a Blight Condition," she may use her passive ability to not gain that Condition instead. If she does, the cost of gaining the Condition has still been paid.
* If a skill of Wendy is impaired while it has an Improvement token, she would still be able to choose not to impair that skill instead.
origin: Wendy Adams made her first appearance in 2008 in Kingsport Horror, the 4th expansion for Arkham Horror: Second Edition.

defeatedEncounters.lossOfHealth: You recognize Wendy's meager belongings for sale in a pawnshop. Gain all of her possessions. The store owner claims an older man brought them in. You scour the city looking for any sign of her or this mysterious man . If you pass, you find her in a hospital being watched over by her father who offers to "take care" of certain problems for you before the two of them disappear; each investigator may discard any number of Conditions. If you fail, you never learn her fate. Whether you pass or not, discard her Investigator token.
defeatedEncounters.lossOfSanity: The doctors at the asylum tell you that Wendy is too dangerous to be seen, but they grant you custody of her belongings. Gain all of her possessions. You try to convince the staff that it is vital that you speak to her . If you pass, Wendy looks at you with pitch black eyes and threatens you in an inhuman voice, whispering ancient secrets; retreat by 1. If you fail, you come back the next day only to discover that she has killed her doctors and escaped. Whether you pass or not, discard her Investigator token.

name: William Yorick
personalStory: To Be Or Not To Be
quote: Though this be madness, yet there is method in't
biography: William Yorick always dreamed of becoming an actor. But alas, poor Yorick, it was not meant to be. As a gravedigger, Yorick saw corpses every day, so when inhuman, monstrous corpses started turning up in Arkham, he took the bodies to Miskatonic University for study. Unfortunately for Yorick, this drew some unwanted attention, and fearing for his life, he took a grave-digging job in Sydney, far from Arkham and far from trouble—at least until the corpses started clawing their way from the ground.
teamRole: William is well-suited to defeating Monsters and closing gates. His ability to knock 2 Assets out of the reserve for free every turn means he can quickly search out a weapon for himself to boost his combat potential.
rulings: Based on the ruling for Patrolling the Streets, if the investigator use Relentless to reduce the Monster's toughness during the Combat Encounter and defeat it, the reduced toughness will be used to calculate whether William's passive ability triggers.
origin: William Yorick made his first appearance in 2008 in Kingsport Horror, the 4th expansion for Arkham Horror: Second Edition. The name is a reference to the skull that the Gravedigger unearths in William Shakespeare's play 'Hamlet'. Yorick was the court jester when Hamlet was a boy. It is not the Gravedigger's name (a common misconception). The name itself (and variants Iorek, Jorik, Jorg) are a Danish/Germanic version of the name "George".

defeatedEncounters.lossOfHealth: You find Yorick in a shelter with a bloody bandage wrapped around his head. One of the attendants hands you a bag of the things found on his person. Gain all of his possessions. Speaking with Yorick, you discover that he cannot retain any new memories for longer than five minutes. You attempt to get Yorick to remember what happened . If you pass, he describes a familiar symbol; retreat by 1. If you fail, he becomes even more confused. Whether you pass or not, discard his Investigator token.
defeatedEncounters.lossOfSanity: You find Yorick sputtering lines from a play in an abandoned warehouse, his things strewn about the floor around him. Gain all of his possessions. Yorick suddenly accuses you of killing his cousin and challenges you to a duel . If you pass, you manage to subdue him and take him to a hostipal where you extract some useful information from him between dramatic soliloquies; retreat by 1. If you fail, he knocks you unconscious and disappears into the city. Whether you pass or not, discard his Investigator token.

name: Wilson Richards
quote: It's nothing a good plan and some hard work can't fix.
biography: Wilson's a practical man. He goes where there's work. When it's gone, he moves on. Wilson finds that offering an honest deal gets him treated honestly, but since he took a job rebuilding a church in Arkham, he's had a hard time being honest with himself. Things that used to hide in the deepest pits of the earth have crawled to the surface. He cannot unsee all the things he's seen, but he can get to work on fixing the problem.
abilities:
Abilities 
* Action: Gain 1 Asset of your choice with value 1 from the reserve; or discard 1 card from the reserve and perform 1 additional action.
* When you or another investigator on your space spend a to reroll a die, that investigator may reroll up to 2 dice instead.
rulings:
*If Wilson or another investigator on Wilson’s space spends a Focus to reroll a die and his dice pool is only one die, that investigator cannot use Wilson’s passive ability.
*Wilson's active ability allows him to gain Relic Unique Assets from the reserve without spending if Wondrous Curios is in play.
origin:
Wilson Richards made his first appearance in 2006 in Dunwich Horror, the 2nd expansion for Arkham Horror: Second Edition.

Wilson Richards' name is a reference to the two designers of Arkham Horror: Second Edition, Kevin Wilson and Richard Launius.

defeatedEncounters.lossOfHealth: This abandoned house is where Wilson was supposed to be. You see his belongings, but no sign of the man. Gain all of his possessions. About to give up, you hear a faint scraping coming from the walls. You tear down the plaster and lath as quickly as you can . If you pass, you pull him out, barely alive and he tells you what he's discovered; retreat by 1. If you fail, you don't get it out in time, and he takes the secrets with him to the grave. Whether you pass or not, discard his Investigator token.
defeatedEncounters.lossOfSanity: When you find Wilson, he's surrounded by countless shards of glass and loose stones he's arranged in some way that is only meaningful to him. As you watch, he moves the debris around his obscure patterns. You spend a few hours trying to speak with him . If you pass, you understand the message he's struggling to communicate; retreat by 1. If you fail, he never speaks another sane word. Whether you pass or not, gain all of his possessions and discard his Investigator token.

name: Zoey Samaras
quote: God has spoken. I will do His work without hesitation.
biography: When Zoey was six years old, her parents were killed in a fire. As the flames consumed her home, God spoke to her. He told Zoey that she was special and that He was giving her a special task. As an adult, she now travels from city to city, taking work as a chef to support herself. When she isn't working, she stalks the night, guided by the Lord's voice. Wherever she finds wickedness, she strikes it down without remorse or hesitation. Most recently, God has called her to Rome, to dispense His righteous fury.
abilities:
Abilities
* Action: If you have fewer than 2 Task Assets, gain 1 Task Unique Asset.
* If you have not lost during a Combat Encounter, roll 2 additional dice when resolving the test during that encounter.
teamRole: Zoey has an effective 6 will and 7 sanity that give her unrivaled durability in combat. She works best as a fighter and gate closer, using spare turns to get or advance tasks to empower herself. She should team up with an Influence character who can get her a weapon.
rulings: Based on the ruling for Handcuffs, Zoey's passive ability cannot be used while encountering a Monster which do not have a test, but can be used while encountering a Monster which has another skill icon in place of the test indicator.
origin: Zoey Samaras made her first appearance in 2009 in Innsmouth Horror, the 6th expansion for Arkham Horror: Second Edition.

defeatedEncounters.lossOfHealth: Zoey's wounds have left her hospitalized and unable to walk. Grudgingly, she's left everything for you in a safety deposit box. Gain all of her possessions. When you return from the bank, the hospital is on fire. You try to find the courage to run in and rescue Zoey . If you pass, Zoey gratefully says a prayer for you; gain 1 Boon Condition. If you fail, the only remnant of her you find among the ashes is an old photo of her as a child with her parents. Whether you pass or not, discard her Investigator token.
defeatedEncounters.lossOfSanity: The priest tell you that Zoey donated all of her belongings to the church, but he understand your work and offers them to you. Gain all of her possessions. He tells you that Zoey has been deep in prayer since she arrived. You try to convince her to speak to you . If you pass, she admits that God gave her one final message of powerful significance and then stopped speaking to her; retreat by 1. If you fail, she steadfastly continues to pray, begging to hear a response. Whether you pass or not, discard her Investigator token.
